index.name: ios
index.subtitle: iOS
index.about: iOS is the world’s most advanced mobile operating system, continually redefining what people can do with a mobile device. Together, the iOS SDK and Xcode IDE make it easy for developers to create revolutionary mobile apps.
index.description: Watch screencasts over a list with the best free videos about iOS mobile platform.

videos.title: Animation Design (Part 1/3)
videos.description: In this video, we will look at the basics of creating artwork using various tools and techniques. We will also identify some of the best practices and tips of game design.

videos.title: Animation Design (Part 2/3)
videos.description: In this part, we are going to actually export our assets and see our animation in a simple Swift game.

videos.title: Form Validation in Swift
videos.description: This screencast is going to cover a quick data validation method using a handy library called 'swift-validator'.

videos.title: Swiftly Testing with Quick
videos.description: Learn about Test-Driven-Development (TDD) by using the awesome Quick testing library for Swift with Adam Leonard.

videos.title: Prototyping with Xcode
videos.description: There are many prototyping tools available to designers, but one of the most valuable prototyping tools is using Xcode directly. By prototyping in Xcode, you as a designer become more immersed and familiar with the development environment, terminology and process. In this video you will learn how to build prototype from flat images to animated pages!

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 1
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about Variables, Constants, Concatenations, Playground, Console and more things about Swift syntax.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 2
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about variable types and casts.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 3
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about type aliases, booleans and tuples.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 4
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about optionals.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 5
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about assertion with assert command.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 6
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about math operators.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 7
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about string and chars manipulation.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 8
videos.description: In this episode you will learn how to use arrays.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 9
videos.description: In this episode you will learn how to handle with dictionaries.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 10
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about control flows using (for / while / do-while) commands.

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 11
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about conditionals commands (if / else / switch / where / continue / break / fallthrough).

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 12
videos.description: In this episode you will learn create and use functions (Part 1).

videos.title: Swift Basics to Advanced - Part 13
videos.description: In this episode you will learn create and use functions (Part 1).

videos.title: Objective-C Basics
videos.description: In this episode, I cover Objective-C the language. I cover the syntax of classes & methods, then go over how to work with objects using retain, release, and autorelease.

videos.title: Diagnosing Memory Problems
videos.description: In this episode, I cover what happens if you make a mistake in your memory management. You'll see how the app behaves as well as how to find & fix these issues using Xcode & Instruments.

videos.title: Serializing Data to Disk
videos.description: This episode will show you how to serialize common objects such as NSArray and NSDictionary to disk, as well as implementing custom object serialization using NSKeyedArchiver.

videos.title: New Objective-C Syntax
videos.description: The latest version of the LLVM compiler supports some excellent new syntax additions to the Objective-C language. In this episode, I cover what the new syntax is, how to use it, and a few caveats to look out for.

videos.title: Core Data Basics
videos.description: Core Data is Apple's framework for persisting data on Mac & iOS. It can be though of as an ORM, however it's probably a lot different than most ORMs you've used in the past.

videos.title: Importing into Core Data
videos.description: In this screencast I'll pull down data from an API, map the JSON to a Core Data Managed Object and import them in bulk on a background thread.

videos.title: Automatic Reference Counting
videos.description: In this episode, I'll show you how to convert your project to use Automatic Reference Counting (or ARC) to eliminate the need to use retain, release, autorelease, and dealloc in your Objective-C code!

videos.title: Xcode 5 Autolayout Improvements
videos.description: This week we have another free bonus video on the improvements that Xcode 5 brings to Autolayout. As something that has been quite obnoxious to work with in the past, many people dismissed auto layout when it was introduced to iOS 6.

videos.title: Hello, iOS 7
videos.description: To celebrate the launch of iOS 7, here is a bonus free screencast covering a few of the concepts in iOS 7 such as the status bar behavior, tint color, and navigation bar transitions.
